contents: Ironically, I owe my first encounter with Tiananmen to a yellowing Communist Party phamphlet. I grabbed it from an old book stand when I was a 14-year-old high school freshman. With all its blatant propaganda and party lies, the book lacked persuasion but outlined a mystery to a teenager's inquiring eyes.  It inspired me to launch an online truth hunt which I concluded with a homework essay calling the murderers by the correct name. My dissident teacher was shocked. He gave it back to me in private, with nothing written or said.
